original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close down, First Capital pushes turnover
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed down on Friday, CSE data showed.
The All Share Price Index was down 0.17 percent, or 17.91 points, at 10,605.
The S&P SL20 index was up 0.41 percent, or 12.48 points, at 3,040.
Market participants said a 30 percent stake trade of First Capital Holdings Plc boosted turnover. “Other than that trades were low ahead of the holiday weekend.” (Colombo/Dec22/2023).
